trans-unit.source: Accessing private Azure clouds with Visual Studio
trans-unit.target: Accessing private Azure clouds with Visual Studio

trans-unit.source: Learn how to access private cloud resources by using Visual Studio.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to access private cloud resources by using Visual Studio.

trans-unit.source: Accessing private Azure clouds with Visual Studio
trans-unit.target: Accessing private Azure clouds with Visual Studio

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: By default, Visual Studio supports public Azure cloud REST endpoints.
trans-unit.target: By default, Visual Studio supports public Azure cloud REST endpoints.

trans-unit.source: This can be a problem, though, if you're using Visual Studio with a private Azure cloud.
trans-unit.target: This can be a problem, though, if you're using Visual Studio with a private Azure cloud.

trans-unit.source: You can use certificates to configure Visual Studio to access private Azure cloud REST endpoints.
trans-unit.target: You can use certificates to configure Visual Studio to access private Azure cloud REST endpoints.

trans-unit.source: You can get these certificates through your Azure publish settings file.
trans-unit.target: You can get these certificates through your Azure publish settings file.

trans-unit.source: To access a private Azure cloud in Visual Studio
trans-unit.target: To access a private Azure cloud in Visual Studio

trans-unit.source: In the management portal for the private cloud, download your publish settings file, or contact your administrator for a publish settings file.
trans-unit.target: In the management portal for the private cloud, download your publish settings file, or contact your administrator for a publish settings file.

trans-unit.source: On the public version of Azure, the link to download this is <link><linkText>https://manage.windowsazure.com/publishsettings/</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: On the public version of Azure, the link to download this is <link><linkText>https://manage.windowsazure.com/publishsettings/</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: (The file you download should have a .publishsettings extension.)
trans-unit.target: (The file you download should have a .publishsettings extension.)

trans-unit.source: In Server Explorer in Visual Studio, choose the Azure node and, on the shortcut menu, choose the Manage Subscriptions command.
trans-unit.target: In Server Explorer in Visual Studio, choose the Azure node and, on the shortcut menu, choose the Manage Subscriptions command.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Manage subscriptions command</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Manage subscriptions command</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Manage Microsoft Azure Subscriptions dialog box, choose the Certificates tab, and then choose the Import button.
trans-unit.target: In the Manage Microsoft Azure Subscriptions dialog box, choose the Certificates tab, and then choose the Import button.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Importing Azure certificates</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Importing Azure certificates</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Import Microsoft Azure Subscriptions dialog box, browse to the folder where you saved the publish settings file and choose the file, then choose the Import button.
trans-unit.target: In the Import Microsoft Azure Subscriptions dialog box, browse to the folder where you saved the publish settings file and choose the file, then choose the Import button.

trans-unit.source: This imports the certificates in the publish settings file into Visual Studio.
trans-unit.target: This imports the certificates in the publish settings file into Visual Studio.

trans-unit.source: You should now be able to interact with your private cloud resources.
trans-unit.target: You should now be able to interact with your private cloud resources.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Importing publish settings</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Importing publish settings</linkText>

trans-unit.target: Next steps
